name: Villa Semana

reviews.text: Bali has an image of beauty and serenity. Much of that is correct. Unfortunately in recent years "discovery" of the island has led to overbuilding, crowding and murderous traffic. Much of it is exciting, but to truly enjoy the experience of Bali, one must find a beautiful, serene corner which reflects all of the charm which Bali still possesses. That corner is without a doubt to be found at Villa Semana. Everything here fits well. From the custom designed villas, which are modern, but not too modern, to the wonderful, thoughtful and considerate staff, to the delicious food and above all to the glorious setting in a small valley over looking the river, with rice paddies on two sides. The hotel was designed perfectly for its setting, with lush vegetation and just the right sort of stone paths which lead you from building to building. The rooms are spacious and well appointed, but also distinctive, with refreshing private pools. . They could not be at a Four Seasons or whatever. They are local culture at its best. The Spa is delightful and outdoor massage above the river is enchanting. The The location is a 15 minute drive to Obud with a friendly and punctual shuttle service. Finishing one's stay at Villa Semana is never to want to leave. I have read most of the reviews and note that they are virtually all enthusiastic. The one or two which are not must be from people who do not understand the importance of taking part in a local culture. This hotel will not remind you of Miami Beach, and for good reason. It will give yo the complete Bali experience. There is no other option in Obud but this one.
reviews.title: Bali as it Should be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed recently at Villa Semana for 3 nights for our 'babymoon' after having a negative experience with another villa close by. We were lucky enough that Semana had one villa still available last minute, and from the moment we arrived there, we couldn't have be happier. It is a gorgeous setting by the river, there is a feeling of peacefulness everywhere on the property. One of the main highlights of the place was the food, the chef was unbelievably talented, every meal was a delight visually and the flavours were incredible. The staff went out of their way to accommodate every request we may have, they truly understand how to look after their guests, nothing we asked for was too much for them. After often hearing 'sorry' at the 2 other places we had stayed at in Bali , where we had experienced many many misunderstanding and mistakes from staff, it was just so refreshing to see the high communication level by staff at Semana. Everything was done correctly the first time. I was also fortunate enough to have an incredible private yoga lesson on the deck next to the river which the resort arranges, the teacher is fabulous. The villa itself was nice. The villa pool was quite small, more of a plunge pool really with a little sun. We used the gorgeous main pool overlooking the river to relax by and swim laps which was ideal as we were the only ones doing so. We would highly recommend Villa Semana, and will certainly be back.
reviews.title: We loved the food, the staff and the serenity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Villa Semana during the last 4 nights of our honeymoon and it was the perfect way to wind down our trip. It has a very relaxing, secluded feel to it that is unbelievably calming. Our room was wonderful with a view overlooking the river below. Private pool was nice, but it was totally covered and in the shade so I was never in for anything more than a quick dip. The main pool of the property is much bigger and will be better for all you sunbathers.
reviews.title: A treasure spot in Ubud
Beautiful location and lovely grounds
reviews.text: The standouts for me here were the SPA and the STAFF. Incredible spa setting right down the by the river which is second to none - you can literally feel your stress melting away. Since the property has such a small amount of villas, the entire staff has the ability to cater right to you. We signed up for the cooking class which is a 1-on-1 experience and it is run by the head chef. They even take you into the Ubud marketplace and tell you about all of the local foods that you will be cooking.

reviews.title: we'll be back !
reviews.text: When we checked out on our final day, we weren't flying out until much later that night, they hooked us up with an amazing driver named Dedi who took us to several interesting spots around the island (temples, coffee fields, a few great places to grab a bite) and we had a blast talking and learning some more about Balinese culture.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went there on our honeymoon! The setting is truly Ubud representative and the villas were awesome! Service and staff very friendly. Spa treatments were also impecable!
reviews.title: Perfect getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I vacationed at Villa Semana for five nights in July 2011. We stayed in one of the pool villas and had a lovely time. The rooms were clean and it was great to wake up to our own private pool. Every evening we came back to fantastic turn down service and the staff did everything in their power to make us feel comfortable. One of my favorite activities was sitting down by the river around 4:00 pm with a drink and read and relax as the locals come to bath. It's a truly beautiful and special place.
reviews.title: Lovely Pool Villa Attended by Amazing Staff

reviews.text: I visited Villa Semana with my husband and 13 year old daughter in July. We had done some research on Trip Advisor and other sites before deciding on this hotel as we did not want to go to a beach resort or one of those big impersonal hotels. And we were reminded again and again of how right our decision was every day.
reviews.title: A little piece of heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in peaceful surroundings a little way away from the hub of Ubud town, nestled among paddy fields, the river and the nearby village. While the feel is very rustic the facilities are not. Right from the time we were received at the airport till the drop back 6 days later we were treated as special guests. With just 10 villas, special attention could be paid to each guest.
reviews.title: Quiet, authentic Balinese experience, with excellent spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Kamboja villa, which was spacious enough over two floors to accommodate all of us. The emphasis was on quiet comfort. With a pool and deck chairs outside there was also the chance to have a dip and relax looking out at the clear skies, listening to the rumbling river, the villagers go around their daily tasks and nature at its pristine best. On days we simply did not want to leave the villa at all. But Bali itself is so beautiful and the hotel's tours are well organised.
reviews.title: Amazing staff, amazing service, amazing villas. Absolutely fantastic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in multiple cities while in Bali on our honeymoon. Villa Semana was the last and it made for a fabulous send off! Their spa is right on the river and hearing the river run while breathing in the fresh air during a massage is luxurious - a definite must do if you stay there. The staff (waiters, chef, drivers, owner, EVERYONE) was delightful and very happy to help. They had wonderful suggestions of sites to see and visit; we had something exciting to do every day and then we would return to our relaxing villa for the evening. The private pool is a great touch, though the water was a little cold for us. We did their cooking class with the executive chef, that was phenomenal - highly recommended. As for other food, the restaurant is great but it's a fairly small menu; we ordered the same things a few different days. It's small and quite and set in nature perfectly. A great place to relax after enjoying all that downtown Ubud has to offer during the day!
reviews.title: A lovely way to end our trip...

reviews.text: My husband and I recently had the holiday of a lifetime at Villa Semana. The service is impeccable, location serene and tranquil, and the resort itself is beautiful beyond words. This is truly a place where you reconnect with nature and indulge in the romantic atmosphere.
reviews.title: I want to make this my second home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we loved the fact that there are no TV's here. It gives you an opportunity to suspend yourself in bliss and be serenaded by the sounds of the birds, the river flowing below and local children laughing and playing in the river.
reviews.title: Semana perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jurg, the owner, is an amazing host. He really made us feel like VIP's and kept us entertained with stories and side-splitting anecdotes. He treated us like family and even gave us rides into town on a few occasions. He also gave us great tips on where to go, buy and eat in Ubud.
reviews.title: Nice getaway into nature

reviews.text: The free shuttle service is extremely convenient, they even pick you up from your restaurant. The drivers are good value too, always happy to chat and have a laugh with you.
reviews.title: Beautiful oasis in the outskirts of Ubud

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not a big hotel (10 villas) and this is great as you feel in a small village !
reviews.title: Great small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is very friendly, the service is quick.
reviews.title: Wonderful little hotel

reviews.text: You have to experience the spa ! Great situation near the Ayung river.
reviews.title: Gorgeous, relaxing and fantastic base for Ubud. I could not fault it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also experienced the morning walk which was nice as the hotel guide is very friendly.
reviews.title: Great service in a tranquil setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a yoga lesson, one of the best I never had ! The teacher comes to the hotel and the yoga lesson takes place in front of the river...magic !
reviews.title: A peaceful sanctuary and perfect place to wind down

description: Villa Semana & Spa is a hidden treasure deep in the Ubud area of Bali. Villa Semana & Spa consists of 10 private pool villas each with unique views of the Ayung River tributaries. Your home away from home offers 180-degrees views of stunning valleys and rice fields that make choosing Ubud an easy decision. Be part of nature and experience total relaxation in the lotus pond bath with sound of near by waterfall.
